cons: Work is not hard but pay could be higher.

pros: Free meals, delicious food, nice residents
cons: Weekend shifts, working holidays, short staff

pros: Residents are delightful. Staff help each other with assignments. Benefits good.
cons: Leadership is out of touch with staff and just don’t seem to care. Always short staffed in every department. Leadership is only concerned with money!

review_title: Fine for some dependable hours, but not worth long-term loyalty
job_title: Dining Room Server in Rockford, IL
pros:
Meals while you work
Flexible Scheduling
Fun to talk with the seniors
Decent pay
cons:
Crab-bucket mentality; working hard nets you nothing but enmity from other employees
No coordination or consideration from other employees, management
Long hours with an early start around 5am
Seniors can be hostile, and you have no recourse but to go back to the kitchen and get a new table
Management would not/will not write you a recommendation, has no interest in you as a person
Lots of hard work due to low staff.

pros: I love the residents and the flexibility management gave me with my hours. When I first got the job, it was while I was in HS and participating in a varsity sport. They allowed me to work for a bit of money and still participate in HS activities. Since then, I was able to up my hours as needed, which was very helpful when saving up for college and such.
cons: For wait staff, the staffing is either way overstaffed or way understaffed. There is no in-between. For me, I didn't like most of my coworkers, however, that is subjective and up to personal opinions.

job_title: Guest Service Associate in Rockford, IL
pros: Flexible schedule, second shift for part-timers, 6 or 7 hour shifts, easy/enjoyable work duties
cons: Part timers get 2-3 days/week, hard to learn with infrequent/unstable hours

pros: The work itself is rewarding, get to know residents on a personal level
cons: Not paid enough for the amount of work, lack of communication among supervisors, always short staffed, always asking if we could work double shifts

pros:
Getting to know and help the residents 
Staff is friendly
Good benefits
cons:
Low wages
Not much room for advancement
